# b00tl3gRSA3

## Problem

Why use p and q when I can use more? Connect with `nc 2019shell1.picoctf.com 47259`.

```
c: 
n: 
e: 65537
```

## Solution

```python
import gmpy2

c = 
n = 
e = 65537

# Prime factors of n (Obtained using https://www.alpertron.com.ar/ECM.HTM)
r = [8893335589, 8978583941, 9466442569, 9602095147, 9703599119, 9952304143, 10040284963, 10116191849, 10210323181, 10351998469, 10768390727, 11478120019, 11587764367, 12175439699, 13232784553, 13520802871, 13546472741, 13736859259, 13752057601, 14115319529, 14188961183, 14430139637, 15027963133, 15099788839, 15490501667, 15526790507, 15802493899, 15962419049, 16105340621, 16555200451, 16702463959, 16856648671, 17012109449, 17137642189 ]

phi_n = 1
for i in range(len(r)):
    phi_n *= (r[i] - 1)

d = gmpy2.invert(e, phi_n)

plain = pow(c, d, n)
print(format(plain, 'x').decode("hex"))
```

**Flag: picoCTF{too_many_fact0rs_3978938}**
